techniques.comment: RansomHub affiliates may abuse Windows Management Instrumentation to execute malicious commands and payloads.
RansomHub affiliates used Mimikatz on Windows systems to gather credentials.
RansomHub affiliates may disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) tooling to avoid detection.
RansomHub affiliates may exploit known vulnerabilities to obtain initial access.
RansomHub affiliates may use Anydesk, a legitimate desktop support and remote access software to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
RansomHub affiliates may hide binaries by renaming executable names.
RansomHub affiliates may log onto systems using the Remote Desk Protocol, then perform actions as the logged-on user.
RansomHub affiliates used PowerShell and Scripts to quickly run and automate intrusion.
RansomHub affiliates may remove logs to inhibit cybersecurity response.
RansomHub affiliates may manipulate accounts to maintain and/or elevate access to victim systems.
RansomHub affiliates may manipulate accounts to maintain and/or elevate access to victim systems.
RansomHub affiliates may steal data by exfiltrating it over an asymmetrically encrypted network protocol other than that of the existing command and control channel.
RansomHub affiliates may steal data by exfiltrating it over an un-encrypted network protocol other than that of the existing command and control channel.
RansomHub affiliates used mass phishing and spear-phishing emails to obtain initial access.
RansomHub affiliates used Mimikatz on Windows systems to gather credentials.
RansomHub affiliates may use password spraying to obtain initial access.
RansomHub affiliates used encryption for ransomware operations.
RansomHub affiliates may buy, steal, or download exploits that can be used during targeting.

RansomHub affiliates may exfiltrate data by transferring the data, including through sharing/syncing and creating backups of cloud environments, to another cloud account they control on the same service.
RansomHub affiliates may create an account to maintain access to victim systems.
RansomHub affiliates may attempt to get a listing of other systems by IP address, hostname, or other logical identifier on a network that may be used for Lateral Movement from the current system.
RansomHub affiliates may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts and local network infrastructure devices,
RansomHub ransomware deleted volume shadow copies and affiliates removed backups for ransomware operations.
